name: Lingering Injuries
description: When a creature takes a critical hit, drops to 0 Hit Points but isn't killed outright, or fails a Death Saving Throw by 5 or more, it may sustain a lingering injury. The DM rolls on the Lingering Injuries table (d20) to determine the result. Injuries range from cosmetic scars to lost limbs, each with specific mechanical effects and healing requirements.

triggers: The creature takes a critical hit
The creature drops to 0 Hit Points but is not killed outright
The creature fails a Death Saving Throw by 5 or more (rolls a 5 or lower)

table.effect: Disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. If both eyes are lost, the creature gains the Blinded condition.
Can no longer hold anything with two hands and can hold only a single object at a time. Cannot wield weapons with the Two-Handed property.
Walking Speed is halved. Must use a cane or crutch to move unless the creature has a prosthetic. Falls Prone after using the Dash action. Disadvantage on Dexterity checks made to balance.
Walking Speed reduced by 5 feet. Must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after using the Dash action or fall Prone.
table.healing: Magical healing or DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The injury heals naturally after 30 days.

table.effect: Whenever the creature attempts an action in combat, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or lose the action and can't use Reactions until the start of its next turn.
table.healing: Magical healing or 10 days of rest

table.effect: Whenever the creature takes damage, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be Stunned until the end of its next turn.
table.healing: Magical healing or 10 days of rest

table.effect: Disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks and Advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.
table.healing: Regenerate spell or magic that removes scars

table.effect: Hit Point Maximum is reduced by 1 at the end of every 24 hours the wound persists. If Hit Point Maximum drops to 0, the creature dies.
table.healing: Any magical healing, or DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check once every 24 hours (10 successes to heal)

table.effect: No mechanical effect. The scar is cosmetic only.

mechanics.generalHealing: Unless otherwise stated, the Regenerate spell can heal any lingering injury, including restoring lost limbs and eyes. A prosthetic limb or similar magic item can mitigate the effects of a lost limb.

interactions: A creature can accumulate multiple lingering injuries; each is tracked separately and their effects stack
The Regenerate spell restores all lost body parts when cast, healing all such injuries simultaneously
Losing both eyes results in the Blinded condition until at least one eye is restored
This rule adds significant lethality and consequence to combat; best suited for gritty or low-magic campaigns
Constitution saving throw proficiency helps with Internal Injury and Broken Ribs effects
DMs may choose to apply this rule only to certain triggers (e.g., only on dropping to 0 HP) to reduce frequency
